```{r}
jpe_data_preliminary <-
    calculate_jpe_data(
        JPI = 278448,
        V.JPI = 280340342,
        timing = "Preliminary"
    )

jpe_data_final <-
    calculate_jpe_data(
        JPI = 311058,
        V.JPI = 452638929,
        timing = "Final"
    )

jpe_data_preliminary |>
    bind_rows(jpe_data_final) |>
    pivot_wider(
        id_cols = Variable,
        names_from = timing,
        values_from = value
    ) |>
    filter(Variable %in% c(
        "f.hat",
        "natural surv rate",
        "JPI",
        "JPE",
        "JPE lower 95% CI",
        "JPE upper 95% CI"
    )) |>
    # slice(2, 1, 3, 4, 5) |> # Change if you want to reorder rows
    noaa_table() |>
    colformat_double(
        i = c(1, 4, 5, 6),
        j = c(2, 3),
        digits = 0,
        big.mark = ","
    )
```


## VWM survival and natural-origin JPE[^1]

[^1]: The Juvenile Production Estimate (JPE) reported here, and implemented in the package WCR.Fisheries.xxxx (available at <NMFS internal github>), uses the "Method 2" approach described in O'Farrell et al. 2018. Staff at the NOAA Fisheries Southwest Fisheries Science Center provide the latest estimates each year for outmigration survival (Arnold Amman) and the fry-to-smolt survival rate (Michael O'Farrell). ### Preliminary estimate

```{r}

    colformat_double(

        digits = 0,

        digits = 4,

    )
```

## Exploration of survival by year

```{r}
survival_by_year_tidy <-
    survival_by_year |>
    pivot_longer(cols = -year) |>
    separate_wider_delim(
        name,
        delim = ".",
        names = c(
            "measure",
            "location",
            "region"
        )
    ) |>
    filter(measure != "SE") |>
    mutate(location = str_to_title(location)) |>
    mutate(year = as.character(year))
```


```{r}
#| fig-height: 7
survival_by_year_tidy |>
    ggplot(aes(
        x = year,
        y = value,
        group = location
    )) +
    geom_col() +
    scale_y_continuous(
        labels = percent_format()
    ) +
    facet_wrap(
        vars(location),
        ncol = 1
    ) +
    labs(title = "Survival Rate by Location") +
    theme_minimal(
        base_family = "Arial",
        base_size = 12
    ) +
    theme(
        axis.title = element_blank(),
        axis.ticks = element_blank(),
        axis.text = element_text(size = 10),
        plot.title = element_text(
            size = 16,
            face = "bold"
        ),
        plot.title.position = "plot",
        panel.spacing = unit(50, "pt"),
        strip.text = element_text(
            hjust = 0,
            size = 12
        )
    )
```
